bill_title: provide legislators with distinctive motor vehicle license plates.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide legislators with distinctive motor vehicle license plates. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 32-5 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any member of the South Dakota Legislature who has complied with all the laws of this state relating to the registration of a motor vehicle may apply to the secretary to receive plates for the motor vehicle bearing a distinctive number and design and designating such person as a state legislator. The distinctive plates shall be designed by the department and subject to the approval of the Executive Board of the Legislative Research Council. The plates shall bear the state seal, the legislative district number, and the words Senate or House of Representatives, whichever is appropriate. The distinctive plates shall be reflectorized and validated each year with a sticker in the same manner as a noncommercial license plate. The distinctive plates shall be in addition to the regular number plates issued for the motor vehicle pursuant to § 32-5-98. The distinctive plates shall be displayed as set forth in § 32-5-98 and the regular number plates shall remain with the motor vehicle. The distinctive plates shall be validated with distinctive stickers and are valid only for the registration year for which the stickers are issued. The annual fee for a set of distinct stickers is twenty-five dollars. The fee for the validation stickers shall be credited to the license plate special revenue fund.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
